name: NSViewController.TransitionOptions
desc: Animation options for view transitions in a view controller.

items.name: static var crossfade: NSViewController.TransitionOptions
items.desc: A transition animation that fades the new view in and simultaneously fades the old view out. You can combine this animation option with any of the “slide” options in this enumeration.

items.name: static var slideUp: NSViewController.TransitionOptions
items.desc: A transition animation that slides the old view up while the new view comes into view from the bottom. In other words, both views slide up.

items.name: static var slideDown: NSViewController.TransitionOptions
items.desc: A transition animation that slides the old view down while the new view slides into view from the top. In other words, both views slide down.

items.name: static var slideLeft: NSViewController.TransitionOptions
items.desc: A transition animation that slides the old view to the left while the new view slides into view from the right. In other words, both views slide to the left.

items.name: static var slideRight: NSViewController.TransitionOptions
items.desc: A transition animation that slides the old view to the right while the new view slides into view from the left. In other words, both views slide to the right.

items.name: static var slideForward: NSViewController.TransitionOptions
items.desc: A transition animation that reflects the user interface layout direction (userInterfaceLayoutDirection) in a “forward” manner, as follows:

items.name: static var slideBackward: NSViewController.TransitionOptions
items.desc: A transition animation that reflects the user interface layout direction (userInterfaceLayoutDirection) in a “backward” manner, as follows

items.name: static var allowUserInteraction: NSViewController.TransitionOptions
items.desc: A transition animation that allows user interaction during the transition.
